column4: ok, what's that secret command to make a network connection work that you just plugged in? dhcp or something?
try ifup / ifdown
ethernet ow wireless?
ethernet. I got it plugged into a second network connection on my computer.
what does ifconfig return?
again what does ifconfig return?
which part? there's many lines it spits out.
but can you even ping your router?
I don't know... uh... it... I think not.
ping -I [interface name] [router ip]
I pinged 192.168.1.1 and it's just sitting there...
sure it is 192.168.1.1 ? some routers are different
yes. positive. I connected to it earlier.
that rules out my next question then, is the cable OK?
well, the light's on.
relax. this is the fun part
you never got to give the ifconfig output to me ?!
I don't know how to do one of those website pastey things.
paste the output in http://paste.ubuntu.com. it will give you a link, that you paste here
what is your main goal?
to get pppoe working on my router. which requires me to connect to my router through Ubuntu to set it up, which I was able to do once, and I have no idea how the hell I managed to do it.
it should be simple to connect you router to your pc
